alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley; Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 8:23AM MST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW BAND... HAZARDS...A band of heavy rain and snow accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 822 AM MST, a band of heavy rain and snow was along a line extending from near Bear Creek Summit to Notus to Rockville School and moving northeast at 55 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Middleton and Paddock Valley Reservoir around 830 AM MST. Emmett, Dodson Pass and Letha around 840 AM MST. Smiths Ferry, Montour, Four Bit Summit and Sage Hen Reservoir around 850 AM MST. Nampa, Caldwell, Sweet and Gardena around 900 AM MST. Northwestern Boise, Meridian, Banks and Cascade around 910 AM MST. SAFETY INFO... Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley; Owyhee Mountains; Upper Treasure Valley; Upper Weiser River; West Central Mountains
